content.question: Which of the following could be a slope field for the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, y cubed, minus x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on both axes. From left to right, each row of segments gradually increases slope from negative values to positive values. All segments in quadrant 1 have positive slopes. All segments in quadrant 3 have negative slopes. From left to right, the slopes of the segments on the x axis gradually increase from negative values to the left of the origin, to 0 at the origin, to positive values to the right of the origin. From top to bottom, the slopes of the segments on the y axis gradually decrease from positive values above the origin, to 0 at the origin, to negative values below the origin.

The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on both axes. From left to right, each row of segments gradually decreases slope from positive values to negative values. All segments in quadrant 2 have positive slopes. All segments in quadrant 4 have negative slopes. From left to right, the slopes of the segments on the x axis gradually decrease from positive values to the left of the origin, to 0 at the origin, to negative values to the right of the origin. From top to bottom, the slopes of the segments on the y axis gradually decrease from positive values above the origin, to 0 at the origin, to negative values below the origin.

The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on both axes. The slopes of all segments are non-negative values. All of the segments in any column are parallel. On the y axis, the segments are all horizontal. From left to right, each row of segments gradually decreases slope from positive values to 0 on the y axis, then gradually increases slope again moving away from the y axis.

The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on both axes. All four quadrants contain slopes with both positive and negative values. From left to right, the slopes of the segments on the x axis gradually increase from negative values to the left of the origin, to 0 at the origin, then gradually decrease slope again moving away from the origin. From top to bottom, the slopes of the segments on the y axis gradually decrease from positive values above the origin, to 0 at the origin, then gradually increase slope again moving away from the origin.

content.answer: The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on both axes. From left to right, each row of segments gradually decreases slope from positive values to negative values. All segments in quadrant 2 have positive slopes. All segments in quadrant 4 have negative slopes. From left to right, the slopes of the segments on the x axis gradually decrease from positive values to the left of the origin, to 0 at the origin, to negative values to the right of the origin. From top to bottom, the slopes of the segments on the y axis gradually decrease from positive values above the origin, to 0 at the origin, to negative values below the origin.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
